name: Vegan Spinach Alfredo Skillet Lasagna
description: Vegan Spinach Alfredo Skillet lasagna makes the perfect weeknight dinner ! An easy vegan pasta recipe that is family-friendly, uses just 1 skillet, and is ready to eat in about 45 minutes!

video.name: VEGAN SPINACH ALFREDO SKILLET LASAGNA - Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
SPINACH ALFREDO LASAGNA | EASY VEGAN LASAGNA RECIPE

Get the WRITTEN RECIPE here - https://www.veganricha.com/spinach-alfredo-skillet-lasagna/

SUBSCRIBE HERE: https://www.youtube.com/veganricharecipes?sub_confirmation=1

Vegan Spinach Alfredo Skillet Lasagna makes the perfect weeknight dinner! An easy vegan pasta recipe that is family-friendly, uses just 1 skillet, and is ready to eat in about 45 minutes!

Bubbling hot lasagna deliciousness…. Are you ready for it? Spinach Alfredo Skillet Lasagna!  A satisfying one-pan meal that your whole family will enjoy! Perfectly cooked lasagna sheets cooked along with a fragrant mix of garlic, sauteed balsamic mushrooms, onions, spinach, and a dreamy cheesy vegan Alfredo Sauce – DROOL ALERT.  An easy dinner fix for lovers of easy one-pot meals and no-fuss pasta dinners!

******MORE PASTA RECIPES FROM THE BLOG******

VEGAN CREAMY CAJUN PASTA WITH BREADED TOFU: https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-creamy-cajun-pasta-with-breaded-tofu/

VEGAN FETTUCCINE ALFREDO WITH MUSHROOMS: https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-fettuccine-alfredo-with-mushrooms-nut-free/

VEGAN LEMON ASPARAGUS PASTA: https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-lemon-asparagus-pasta/

COOKBOOKS BY RICHA HINGLE (VEGAN RICHA): https://www.veganricha.com/mybooks/

#veganlasagna #spinachlasagna #veganricha #easyveganrecipes

recipeIngredient: 6-8 ounces spinach (chopped spinach, or thawed if frozen)
3/4 cup raw cashews (soaked in hot water for 15 mins, drain and use)
1 tsp Italian herbs such as thyme (oregano, basil)
5-6  regular lasagna sheets broken into pieces, (or 8 no boil lasagna sheets, or use 2 cups dried pasta such as Farfalle )

recipeInstructions.text: Add oil to a large skillet over medium heat, then add garlic and cook until the garlic is starting to turn golden, then add in the spinach, salt and pepper flakes, and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add oil to a large skillet over medium heat, then add garlic and cook until the garlic is starting to turn golden, then add in the spinach, salt and pepper flakes, and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the spinach is wilted, take off heat, and remove the spinach from the skillet into a bowl. For frozen spinach, just cook until the excess the water has dried out, but the spinach still has a lot of vibrant color.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the spinach is wilted, take off heat, and remove the spinach from the skillet into a bowl. For frozen spinach, just cook until the excess the water has dried out, but the spinach still has a lot of vibrant color.

recipeInstructions.text: For the sauce, blend all of the ingredients until smooth then set aside. You can blend for a minute, then wait for 5 minutes, so that the blended cashews rehydrate, and then blend again, so that the mixture will be smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: For the sauce, blend all of the ingredients until smooth then set aside. You can blend for a minute, then wait for 5 minutes, so that the blended cashews rehydrate, and then blend again, so that the mixture will be smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: For the Skillet Lasagna, heat oil in the same skillet, add the onion, mushroom, garlic, salt, and pepper, and cook until the onion is golden, 6-8 minutes. Stir occasionally in between.
recipeInstructions.name: For the Skillet Lasagna, heat oil in the same skillet, add the onion, mushroom, garlic, salt, and pepper, and cook until the onion is golden, 6-8 minutes. Stir occasionally in between.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the balsamic vinegar, and mix in and cook for another 2 minutes. Then add your broken lasagna sheets, water or broth, and about 3/4 of the blended alfredo sauce (or reserve 2 tbsp and use the rest), and mix in. cover the skillet and cook for 12-14 minutes. Stir once in between so the sheets don’t stick to each other . If the mixture is thickening too much, add in 2-4 tbsp more water or broth.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the balsamic vinegar, and mix in and cook for another 2 minutes. Then add your broken lasagna sheets, water or broth, and about 3/4 of the blended alfredo sauce (or reserve 2 tbsp and use the rest), and mix in. cover the skillet and cook for 12-14 minutes. Stir once in between so the sheets don’t stick to each other . If the mixture is thickening too much, add in 2-4 tbsp more water or broth.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the lasagna sheets are cooked to preference, reduce the heat to low medium. Taste and adjust salt and flavor.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the lasagna sheets are cooked to preference, reduce the heat to low medium. Taste and adjust salt and flavor.

recipeInstructions.text: Distribute the cooked garlic spinach all over the skillet, and drizzle the remaining alfredo sauce all over as well, then cover and cook for the two minutes, and take off heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Distribute the cooked garlic spinach all over the skillet, and drizzle the remaining alfredo sauce all over as well, then cover and cook for the two minutes, and take off heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the skillet sit for a few minutes for the alfredo sauce to thicken a bit more, then serve with some extra pepper flakes on top if you like, or some toasted bread crumbs.
recipeInstructions.name: Let the skillet sit for a few minutes for the alfredo sauce to thicken a bit more, then serve with some extra pepper flakes on top if you like, or some toasted bread crumbs.
